thread.title: Tube strike 2017 updates: which lines and stations are now open?
thread.title_full: Tube strike 2017 updates: which lines and stations are now open?

author: Chloe Chaplain
title: Tube strike 2017 updates: which lines and stations are now open?
text:
FA Cup fourth round draw: Start time, teams, dates and ball numbers 
Commuters are battling to get to work this morning amid chaos caused by the 24-hour Tube strike . 
As of 8am most eight of the 11 Tube lines were beginning to operate but with closures across the whole network. 
Transport for London warned commuters that Zone 1 stations within the Circle Line boundary are likely to remain closed all day. 
A statement warned that that buses and roads would be busier throughout the day - particularly bus routes serving major interchange stations. Tube strike: Customers have been advised that bus routes will be very busy (Jeremy Selwyn) 
Tube lines: 
Bakerloo Line is operating between Harrow & Wealdstone and Marylebone. Trains will run non-stop from Queens Park to Marylebone. 
Central Line trains are running from Ealing Broadway to White City, West Ruislip to North Acton, Epping/Hainault to Liverpool Street and Hainault to Woodford. Tube strike: Commuters waiting for a bus (Jeremy Selwyn) 
There are minor delays on the District Line . 
Jubilee Line is operating every five minutes and has various stations closed. Tube strike explained Commuters face rush hour travel misery due to 24-hour Tube strike 
The Northern Line is operating from Edgware to Golders Green, High Barnet to East Finchley and Kennington to Morden. 
And the Piccadilly Line is running from Acton Town to Uxbridge, Hammersmith to Heathrow and Cockfosters to Arnos Grove. 
There is no service on the London Overground from Clapham Junction to Wandsworth Road and Clapham Junction to Kensington due to overcrowding. 
The Circle, Hammersmith and City, Waterloo and City and Victoria lines are all closed. 
There is a good service on DLR, Metropolitan Line and London Tra m services. 
Station closures: 
TfL has announced several Tube stations are closed due to the strike. Station closures: Key stations will not be open (Peter Clifton/PA) 
Stations that are closed today are: 
Aldgate East
